[b]Blizzard BANS You[/b] in Community for posting the only good thing left about this game.
[b]Blizzard, not Valve[/b] - confirmed by Support.

And I've posted not a Nissan R34 Skyline Art. Not a p*rn video. Not any disturbing form of content.
But an [b]IN-GAME[/b] screenshot. Just THINK about this. 
Developer bans you for posting "wrong" in-game content related to its own game (Thus - for 99% of content)
And I'm not alone in this - basically every user with a hint of "not right" got a warning.

I mean... Banning an Overwatch 'Ero' content - is already like extinguishing fire with gasoline.
But we're speaking about IN-GAME content.

And this - is the company responsible for making chicks like Kerrigan, Jaina, Whitemane, Sylvanas, Alexstrasza, Anduin.
This company is rotten now completely.

We're not happy to see you at Steam, to say the least.
You've finally betrayed not only your fans, but yourself.
No offense in my overall message, just pure facts.


P.S. The link to the INNOCENT in-game screenshot: steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/2047501598604701517/74F5238E1F1F9AF5C78DF0E373F3921D4734062F/

Also this review IS related to actual game (more on that - in comments)
I am mentioning wrong product's positioning and totalitarian anti-consumer measures of developer. Basically, 99% content of this game is forbidden now.
Blizzard just comes to Steam, and spits their fanbase in the faces.

I'm not mad. I am just disappointed.

[h1] Is this game good. Absolutely Yes. Is the game being ruined by Blizzards mistakes? Yes. Have Blizzard lied to the players and made a mess out of PvE. Oh yeah 100% [/h1]

There are a lot of massive issues with Blizzard recently regarding both monetisation and their absolutely disgraceful handling of the PvE. There is no getting around these issues and 90% of reviews focus on these problems.

Overwatch 2 is one of the best games of all time in my opinion with countless hours of content, many updates planned and massive Blizzard polish. The game has some of the best character diversity in gaming (Thanks to King's Diversity Space Tool which made it's run in the news - +1 points for the character being female and all). The gameplay is smooth with some balancing issues here and there, which sometimes get addressed and sometimes don't. The map variety, gamemodes, workshop content, skins and character abilities are all outstanding, diverse and beautifully made and I am surprised at how well Blizzard have made a hero shooter to this standard back in 2016 when the genre was next to non-existent. The clutter and confusion in the game is one of the hardest points for a new player to get past but you get used to that.

It would be foolish of me to not mention that Overwatch 2, being the sequel to Overwatch 1 was promised as being a expansive PvE experience, which they themselves described as being as repayable as Destiny 2. It is barely anything close to that and instead a disastrous failure of a sequel. However, unlike what the playerbase had to deal with while they discovered that they are too incompetent to make a PvE, the game is being updated, there is a lot of work being done and the PvP, which is the true meat of this game, is outstanding. The game is live service and depending on how it proceeds may continue to get better, or the whales will take over and everything will cost money in the game.

The art, sound, animation, story and design team always will bring this game to a 10/10. The gameplay and programming teams seem to let them down, and countless times miss their mark. Hopefully the brigading of OW2 on Steam starts to slow down so that people can actually see that the game is actually a really damn good game and that it is only a few obvious issues bringing the game down to the reviewing masses. It does not deserve a sub 30% positive reviews. But then again, I am a Blizzard shill so who the hell cares. TF2 is better or whatever people seem to be trying to say.

The game is free, pick it up and decide for yourself if the love that the Blizzard team put into the game ages ago can at all be enjoyed. Don't let reviews complaining about issues that you wouldn't even know about bring your opinion down.

è¯¸ä½å°†å†›æ—¢ä¸ºæœä¸­è‚±éª¨ï¼Œå›½ä¸­æ ‹æ¢ï¼Œä»Šå±æ€¥å­˜äº¡ä¹‹æ—¶ï¼Œå½“ç«‹ä¸ä¸–ä¹‹åŠŸï¼Œä»¥æŒ½å€¾é¢“ä¹‹äº‹ï¼Œè€Œéå¦–è¨€æƒ‘ä¼—ï¼Œä¸ºçƒ¤è¿ªå…‹å‹Ÿå…µï¼Œæ‰°ä¹±æœçº²ï¼Œä½¿å¿ è‡£å—éš¾ã€‚ä¸ä¸ºå‹¤ç‹ä¹‹ä¸Šå°†ï¼Œå›ºæ”¿ä¹‹åå£«ï¼ŒçœŸä¹ƒå›ä¾§ä¹‹ä½è‡£ï¼Œå¤§æ±‰ä¹‹è´¥ç±»ã€‚å€¼æ­¤å¤šéš¾ä¹‹ç§‹ï¼Œè¯¸ä½è‹¥å¹¿åˆ·å·®è¯„ï¼Œæ–­çƒ¤è¿ªå…‹ä¹‹ç²®ï¼Œè¯›æš´é›ªä¹‹é©¬ï¼Œå±•äºæœå ‚ä¼—è‡£ï¼Œäº¦å¯å¨éœ‡ä¹å·ï¼Œåå‚é’å²ï¼Œä¸æ‰æ­¤ç”Ÿã€‚

It's Overwatch. it's fun but Activision/Blizzard's CEO's obsession with Overwatch League forced devs into pushing out an unfinished game just so that OL could start again with OW2, putting the focus on PvP life service stuff instead of the promised PvE campaign with tons of replayability and talent trees and whatnot. Pretty sad. No wonder most of the original OW team has left. Matchmaking is a joke, competitive is terrible in OW2, Battle Passes are filled with junk no one uses, the game is lacking multiple features that we had before, monetization is super expensive (20$ for skins that were previously obtainable for free via lootboxes you got while levelling up), PvE that is being released is super lackluster compared to what was promised + you HAVE to pay for EACH mission pack instead of just buying access to the campaign once.

It feels like Blizzard's management really messed up OW2's development and I don't blame the devs for it. The game is in a pretty bad state, yet I'm somewhat optimistic; seasons seem to slowly add in features that makes the game a little more enjoyable even though most of those were old features that we missed in the launch of OW2. The devs seem to be trying their best to make do with what they have and I thank them for it, and Activ/Blizz might be getting bought out by Microsoft and I hope kicking out Kotick is their first action when the merger comes through.

Game's alright, I'll play it, but I really hope things get better because OW2's launch has been atrocious, and they're losing a lot of their playerbase because of it, but the game has so much potential, I really hope it gets to live on and become something genuinely good again.

æ€ä¹ˆè¿˜æ²¡æœ‰å·®è¯„å¦‚æ½®æ€ä¹ˆè¿˜æ²¡æœ‰å·®è¯„å¦‚æ½®æ€ä¹ˆè¿˜æ²¡æœ‰å·®è¯„å¦‚æ½®ï¼Ÿä¸‹åˆèµ·åºŠä½ ä»¬å†ä¸æ”»å‡»çƒ¤è¿ªå…‹æˆ‘å°±è¦æ”»å‡»ä½ ä»¬äº†ğŸ‘ŠğŸ‘ŠğŸ‘Šè¯·ä½ ä»¬æ”»å‡»æ€§æ‹‰æ»¡okï¼Ÿ

I loved Overwatch, and in reality, I still do, but it pains me to see what the game has become. It terrifies me how quickly a beloved game turned into a terribly monetized shell of a game, all because of griddy higher-ups. 

Back in the good ol' days, we had loot boxes, we could buy skins for a currency that was fully earnable in-game and you'll never guess what else: the game was fun and enjoyable. I suppose that those who played Overwatch back then can relate.

I want to believe that something will change in the future. With every season, I get my hopes up that maybe, just maybe, we will see a light at the end of the tunnel. After that loud PvE cancellation back in May, most of my patience with this game jumped out the window. I still do have some patience left, although it is slowly but surely running out.

Some finishing words: Blizzard never fails to disappoint <3

Let me preface this review by saying that Overwatch was one of the most fun, exciting, and enjoyable games I've ever played. I believe there is no other game out right now that rivaled how good it felt to find a character you enjoy and be able to play them for hours on end in short casual matches as well as competitive environments. The diversity of it's characters in every aspect is near unparalleled in the industry which makes writing this negative review is so frustrating.
Despite the games strengths, Activision Blizzard is the most out of touch, money hungry, soulless corporation I've ever seen and it breaks my heart that their influence has poisoned this game beyond repair multiple times over. 
While it may display on my review that i only have ~0.5 hours, I've played for around 210 hours before Overwatch came to steam and my hours are split pretty evenly between hours played in Overwatch 1 and Overwatch 2. I first played Overwatch 1 in its twilight months and fell in love with it. I was happy to play for hours at a time as my favorite characters with or without friends in the lobby with me and although i was playing during the time of little to no updates and stagnating metas, the unadulterated fun I had was testament enough that at its core Overwatch was a good game and with the heavy marketing for Overwatch 2 on the horizon I was ecstatic to try out the new highly replayable PvE campaign with broad skill trees, diverse enemy types, new maps, expanding lore, and all the bells and whistles to catch the eye of a new excited player such as myself especially since the Archives missions were my favorite part of the Overwatch experience. 
Once Overwatch 2 was released back in October of last year I hopped back in and found that the magic was still there, but many small things were wrong and/or missing. Where was the "On Fire" system? Your character still said the voiceline to indicate it but with no corresponding visual. What happened to the Medals system? What happened to post game lobbies to honor your allies and even enemies? Why was Bastion, Mei, and Torbjorn all disabled for about the first month of the games release? Where was my account level and border? Where is the weapon inspect animation? and last but certainly not least, Where was the PvE campaign? I found many of these things confusing, but not enough to make the game unplayable, and based on developer messages many of these things were simply coming at a later date, namely the On Fire, Weapon Inspect, and PvE campaign, but you can bet that the shop page was 110% fully operational with skins and battlepasses all ready for your purchase on day one.
But on May 16th 2023, we recieved news that the PvE campaign was being tremendously downsized and cut of most if not all features to make it interesting or worthwhile. With this announcement it sent a message that Blizzard doesn't care. Most of the people who even pitched Overwatch 2 to focus on PvE aren't even at the company anymore, and it was the remaining and new employees to have this vision they didnt concieve or possible not even agree with, all of a sudden thrust upon them and try to deliver. The PvE was reportedly taking too much time and resources away from the live service. It was stated that "the effort required to pull all of that together into a Blizzard quality experience that we can ship to you is huge" and me being relatively new to Overwatch and more importantly Blizzard is that I don't know what "Blizzard quality" means. With a surface level understanding of the internets consensus on Blizzards other games the last couple years "Blizzard quality" was probably the farthest thing from a compliment i could think of. Additionally the skeleton of the PvE mode was going to cost $15. Once this news broke I completed the current seasons battle pass that I had spent money on as fast as possible, uninstalled the game and have been watching from afar ever since.
Others have gone into far more detail about the history of both Overwatch and Blizzards failings and they put it into ways and discuss additional elements not discussed here as well as going beyond what i'm capable of expressing and I highly recommend you to watch any YouTube video discussing this topic.
Overall, Overwatch has a special place in my memory and the core of a good game is still there, but it seems like the priorities of Overwatch 2 and Blizzard do nothing but disappoint and mislead their customers.
